question: 撮る
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>photograph</kanji>. When you make that into a verb, you are doing a photograph, aka making it become <vocabulary>to take a picture</vocabulary>. It can also be <vocabulary>to film</vocabulary> as well. Really anything to do with a camera.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Think of the reading like you do the meaning <vocabulary>to take a photograph</vocabulary>. You "take" all these things, and how do you say "to take" in Japanese? It's <ja>取る</ja>, aka <ja><reading>とる</reading></ja>, which happens to be the same reading!
